title: Nodal decomposition
summary: In category theory, an abstract mathematical discipline, a nodal decomposition[1] of a morphism φ : X → Y {\displaystyle \varphi :X\to Y} is a representation of φ {\displaystyle \varphi } as a product φ = σ ∘ β ∘ π {\displaystyle \varphi =\sigma \circ \beta \circ \pi } , where π {\displaystyle \pi } is a strong epimorphism,[2][3][4] β {\displaystyle \beta } a bimorphism, and σ {\displaystyle \sigma } a strong monomorphism.[5][3][4]
